title: Personal Injury case is going to trial unless we can agree at mediation , mean while i still need medical attention ?
question: The doctors i saw before the filing of the law suit suggested that i would need to see a neuro psychologist and follow up on the possibility of surgery , but i was told that once we sent out the letter of demand the option to seek further medical was no longer open to me i assumed that we would be settling and decided i would seek further medical assistance on my own after settlement in order to not accrue any more medical debt out of pocket , but now we are looking at trial if we cant come to a agreement at mediation so where does that leave me medically ? My need for a neuropsychologist is urgent for me as well as finding relive from the physical pain i continue to suffer from will my attorneys be able to cover me thru liens or should they ? and will the findings be added to my case ?
answers: You should seek the advise of your attorney. You do have the option of seeking a second opinion from another attorney. For another attorney to properly evaluate your situation, you will need to schedule an appointment so that they can fully understand the situation. This type of forum does not lend itself to evaluating a case that is so close to trial.

This is a question that should directly be answered by your attorney. He/She knows your case and can better explain to you the ins and outs better than anyone on avvo as we do not know the specifics of your case. Good luck
Ask your personal injury counsel as they are in the best position to now and this is not a malpractice issue.
Either result, a settled mediation or verdict at trial ends it. Talk to your attorney. The other parties' insurer wants a release, an end, a finish and they don't ever agree to future payments, ever.
Ask your attorney in regards to legal matters and your doctor in regards to the medical matters

Please review the experimental non-surgical field of neuropsychology https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neuropsychology before getting to concerned about it. You can get evaluation at any time though such should be coordinated with your lawyer and any insurance coverage. There ordinarily is a long time between mediation and trial during which settlement is possible. Otherwise, I concur with my Avvo colleagues and decline to comment further.
